Waypoints.Name: Overview
Waypoints.Description:
In this low magnification view, there is an acute myocardial infarction with 
neutrophils in the interstitial space next to a remote infarct with dense 
collagen deposition.

Waypoints.Name: Stunned Myocardium
Waypoints.Description:
Between areas of acute infarction and remote infarct and the endocardial lining 
is a zone of viable myocytes that is approximately five myocytes in thickness. 

These cells have the vacuolization that is characteristic of stunned myocardium. 
Such features result when the myocytes are unable to maintain ionic homeostasis 
and there is water accumulation in the intracellular compartment. 

These myocytes can become isolated from the contractile apparatus and can 
become the substrate for tachyarrhythmias.

Waypoints.Name: Wavy Fibers
Waypoints.Description:
This is high magnification view of a region of acutely ischemic myocytes termed 
wavy fibers (approximately 6-12 hours). The force of contracting neighboring 
fibers cause the non-contractile fibers to stretch and fold, ultimately forming 
the wavy pattern.
